sentence: Mike DeWine is facing three GOP challengers from the right, while two former mayors — Nan Whaley of Dayton and John Cranley of Cincinnati — are vying for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination.
author: JULIE CARR SMYTH
title: EXPLAINER: Why disputed maps won't stop Ohio's May 3 primary

sentence: Mike DeWine is facing three GOP challengers from the right, while two former mayors — Nan Whaley of Dayton and John Cranley of Cincinnati — are vying for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination.
author: JULIE CARR SMYTH Associated Press
title: EXPLAINER: Why disputed maps won't stop Ohio's May 3 primary

sentence: On the Democratic ballot, John Cranley, a former mayor of Cincinnati, and Nan Whaley, the outgoing mayor of Dayton, are vying to be the Democratic candidate for governor in the November general election.
author: Carol Simmons
title: Ohio voters face split primary
